section.title: Section 7.5 Equations that Include Algebraic Fractions

statement.p: Use a graph to solve the equation ~2x^3+9x^2-8x+36=0

solution.p: We graph the equation ~y=2x^3+9x^2-8x+36~ and look for the points where ~y=0~ (the x-intercepts).
From the graph, we estimate the solutions at ~x=-4.5,~x=-2, and ~x=-2. By substituting each of these values into the original equation, you can verify that they are indeed solutions.

statement.p: Use a graph to solve the equation ~x^2+2x+3 = 15-2x

solution.p: We graph the equations ~y_1=x^2+2x+3~ and ~y_2=15-2x~ and look for points on the two graphs where the coordinates are equal (intersection points).
From the graph, we see that the points with ~x=-6~ and ~x=2~ have the same y-coordinate on both graphs. In other words, ~y_1=y_2~ when ~x=-6~ or ~x=2~, so ~x=-6~ and ~x=2~ are the solutions.

assemblage.title: Property of Proportions
assemblage.p: We can clear the fractions from a proportion by cross-multiplying. \text{If}~~~~\dfrac{a}{b} = \dfrac{c}{d},~~~~\text{then}~~~~ad=bc.

statement.p: If 3 pounds of coffee beans makes 225 cups, how many pounds of coffee beans will you need to make 3000 cups of coffee?

solution.p: We assume that the number of cups is proportional to the amount of coffee beans. That is, the ratio of cups to coffee beans is constant. So \dfrac{225~ \text{cups}}{3~ \text{pounds}} \amp = \dfrac{3000~ \text{cups}}{x~ \text{pounds}} \dfrac{225}{3} \amp = \dfrac{3000}{x} Cross-multiplying, we find 225x \amp = 3(3000) x \amp = \dfrac{3(3000)}{225}= 40 You will need 40 pounds of coffee beans.

statement.p: A cinnamon bread recipe calls for 1 \frac{1}{4}tablespoons of cinnamon and 5 cups of flour. Write and solve a proportion to discover how much cinnamon would be needed with 8 cups of flour.

Solve each quadratic equation by the easiest method.
2x^2-2x=3
(2x-1)^2=3
2x^2-x=3

li.p: Because ~2x^2-2x-3~ does not factor, we use the quadratic formula. x = \dfrac{2 \pm \sqrt{(-2)^2-4(2)(-3)}}{2(2)} = \dfrac{2\pm \sqrt{28}}{4} = \dfrac{1 \pm \sqrt{7}}{2}
We write the equation in standard form and factor the left side. 2x^2-x-3 \amp = 0 (2x-3)(x+1) \amp = 0 2x-3=0~~~~x+1 \amp = 0 x = \dfrac{3}{2}~~~~x \amp = -1
